text_sanskrit: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच: धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः | मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ||
text_transliteration: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca: dharma-kṣetre kuru-kṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ | māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāś caiva kim akurvata sañjaya ||
text_english: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, assembled on the sacred field of Kurukshetra, eager to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?
speaker: Dhritarashtra

text_sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच: दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा | आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत् ||
text_transliteration: sañjaya uvāca: dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṃ vyūḍhaṃ duryodhanas tadā | ācāryam upasaṅgamya rājā vacanam abravīt ||
text_english: Sanjaya said: Having seen the army of the Pandavas drawn up in battle formation, King Duryodhana approached his teacher Drona and spoke these words.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् | व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ||
text_transliteration: paśyaitāṃ pāṇḍu-putrāṇām ācārya mahatīṃ camūm | vyūḍhāṃ drupada-putreṇa tava śiṣyeṇa dhīmatā ||
text_english: Behold, O Teacher, this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by your intelligent disciple, the son of Drupada.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि | युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ||
text_transliteration: atra śūrā maheṣvāsā bhīmārjuna-samā yudhi | yuyudhāno virāṭaś ca drupadaś ca mahā-rathaḥ ||
text_english: Here are heroes, mighty archers, equal in battle to Bhima and Arjuna: Yuyudhana, Virata, and Drupada, the great chariot-warrior.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् | पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः ||
text_transliteration: dhṛṣṭaketuś cekitānaḥ kāśirājaś ca vīryavān | purujit kuntibhojaś ca śaibyaś ca nara-puṅgavaḥ ||
text_english: Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, the valiant King of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, and Shaibya, the best among men.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् | सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः ||
text_transliteration: yudhāmanyuś ca vikrānta uttamaujāś ca vīryavān | saubhadro draupadeyāś ca sarva eva mahā-rathāḥ ||
text_english: The heroic Yudhamanyu, the valiant Uttamauja, the son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadi—all great chariot-warriors.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम | नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते ||
text_transliteration: asmākaṃ tu viśiṣṭā ye tān nibodha dvi-jottama | nāyakā mama sainyasya saṃjñārthaṃ tān bravīmi te ||
text_english: O best of the twice-born, know also the distinguished ones among us, the leaders of my army. I shall name them for your information.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जयः | अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ||
text_transliteration: bhavān bhīṣmaś ca karṇaś ca kṛpaś ca samitiñjayaḥ | aśvatthāmā vikarṇaś ca saumadattis tathaiva ca ||
text_english: Yourself, Bhishma, Karna, Kripa—ever victorious in battle—Ashwatthama, Vikarna, and also the son of Somadatta.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः | नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः ||
text_transliteration: anye ca bahavaḥ śūrā mad-arthe tyakta-jīvitāḥ | nānā-śastra-praharaṇāḥ sarve yuddha-viśāradāḥ ||
text_english: And many other heroes ready to give up their lives for my sake, equipped with various weapons and missiles, all skilled in the art of warfare.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् | पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम् ||
text_transliteration: aparyāptaṃ tad asmākaṃ balaṃ bhīṣmābhirakṣitam | paryāptaṃ tv idam eteṣāṃ balaṃ bhīmābhirakṣitam ||
text_english: The strength of our army is unlimited and we are safely marshalled by Grandsire Bheeshma, while the strength of the Pandava army, carefully marshalled by Bheem, is limited.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्ध: पितामह: | सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चै: शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ||
text_transliteration: tasya sañjanayan harṣhaṁ kuru-vṛiddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ | siṁha-nādaṁ vinadyochchaiḥ śhaṅkhaṁ dadhmau pratāpavān ||
text_english: Then, the grand old man of the Kuru dynasty, the glorious patriarch Bheeshma, roared like a lion, and blew his conch shell very loudly, giving joy to Duryodhan.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: तत: शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखा: | सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ||
text_transliteration: tataḥ śhaṅkhāśhcha bheryaśhcha paṇavānaka-gomukhāḥ | sahasaivābhyahanyanta sa śhabdastumulo ’bhavat ||
text_english: Thereafter, conches, kettledrums, bugles, trumpets, and horns suddenly blared forth, and their combined sound was overwhelming.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: तत: श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ | माधव: पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतु: ||
text_transliteration: tataḥ śhvetairhayairyukte mahati syandane sthitau | mādhavaḥ pāṇḍavaśhchaiva divyau śhaṅkhau pradadhmatuḥ ||
text_english: Then, from amidst the Pandava army, seated in a glorious chariot drawn by white horses, Madhav and Arjun blew their Divine conch shells.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जय: | पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदर: ||
text_transliteration: pāñchajanyaṁ hṛiṣhīkeśho devadattaṁ dhanañjayaḥ | pauṇḍraṁ dadhmau mahā-śhaṅkhaṁ bhīma-karmā vṛikodaraḥ ||
text_english: Hrishikesh blew his conch shell, called Panchajanya, and Arjun blew the Devadutta. Bhima, the voracious eater and performer of mighty deeds, blew his mighty conch, called Paundra.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिर: | नकुल: सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ ||
text_transliteration: anantavijayaṁ rājā kuntī-putro yudhiṣhṭhiraḥ | nakulaḥ sahadevaśhcha sughoṣha-maṇipuṣhpakau ||
text_english: King Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, blew his conch named Anantavijaya, Nakula and Sahadeva blew their conches called Sughosa and Manipushpaka.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: | धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजित: ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | kāśyaḥ param eṣvāsaḥ śhikhaṇḍī cha mahā-rathaḥ | dhṛṣhṭadyumno virātaśh cha sātyakiḥ āprajitaḥ ||
text_english: Kashya, the great archer; Shikhandi, the mighty warrior; Dhrishtadyumna, Virata, and Satyaki—the undefeatable—also blew their conches.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते | सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक् पृथक् ||
text_transliteration: drupado draupadeyāśhcha sarvaśhaḥ pṛithivī-pate | saubhadraśhcha mahā-bāhuḥ śhaṅkhāndadhmuḥ pṛithak pṛithak ||
text_english: Drupada, the sons of Draupadi, and O Lord of the Earth, the mighty-armed Abhimanyu—each of them blew their own conch..
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् | नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलोऽभ्यनुनादयन् ||
text_transliteration: sa ghoṣho dhārtarāṣhṭrāṇāṁ hṛidayāni vyadārayat | nabhaśhcha pṛithivīṁ chaiva tumulo abhyanunādayan ||
text_english: The terrific sound thundered across the sky and the earth, and shattered the hearts of your sons, O Dhritarasthra.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान् कपिध्वज: | प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डव: | हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते ||
text_transliteration: atha vyavasthitān dṛiṣhṭvā dhārtarāṣhṭrān kapi-dhwajaḥ | pravṛitte śhastra-sampāte dhanurudyamya pāṇḍavaḥ | hṛiṣhīkeśhaṁ tadā vākyam idam āha mahī-pate ||
text_english: At that time, the son of Pandu, Arjun, who had the insignia of Hanuman on the flag of his chariot, took up his bow. Seeing your sons arrayed against him, O King, Arjun then spoke the following words to Shree Krishna.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच: सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत ||
text_transliteration: arjuna uvācha: senayor ubhayor madhye rathaṁ sthāpaya me ’chyuta ||
text_english: Arjuna said: “O Achyuta, place my chariot between the two armies.”
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् | कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन् रणसमुद्यमे ||
text_transliteration: yāvadetān nirīkṣhe ’haṁ yoddhu-kāmān avasthitān | kairmayā saha yoddhavyam asmin raṇa-samudyame ||
text_english: Let me see those who have assembled here, eager to fight, and with whom I must battle in this great war.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागता: | धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षव: ||
text_transliteration: yotsyamānān avekṣhe ’haṁ ya ete ’tra samāgatāḥ | dhārtarāṣhṭrasya durbuddher yuddhe priya-chikīrṣhavaḥ ||
text_english: I desire to see those who have come here to fight on the side of the evil-minded son of Dhritarasthra, wishing to please him.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच: एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत | सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ||
text_transliteration: sañjaya uvācha: evam ukto hṛiṣhīkeśho guḍākeśhena bhārata | senayor ubhayor madhye sthāpayitvā rathottamam ||
text_english: Sanjay said: O Dhritarasthra, having thus been addressed by Arjun, the conqueror of sleep, Shree Krishna then drew the magnificent chariot between the two armies.
speaker: Sanjay

text_sanskrit: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखत: सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् | उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति ||
text_transliteration: bhīṣhma-droṇa-pramukhataḥ sarveṣhāṁ cha mahī-kṣhitām | uvācha pārtha paśhyaitān samavetān kurūn iti ||
text_english: In the presence of Bheeshma, Dronacharya, and all the other kings, Shree Krishna said: O Parth, behold these Kurus gathered here.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान् पार्थ: पितृ नथ पितामहान् | आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातृ न्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा || श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि ||
text_transliteration: tatrāpaśhyat sthitān pārthaḥ pitṝīn atha pitāmahān | āchāryān mātulān bhrātṝīn putrān pautrān sakhīṁs tathā | śhvaśhurān suhṛidaśh chaiva senayor ubhayor api ||
text_english: There, Arjun could see stationed in both armies, his fathers, grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, cousins, sons, nephews, grand-nephews, friends, fathers-in-law, and well-wishers.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेय: सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान् || कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् |
text_transliteration: tān samīkṣhya sa kaunteyaḥ sarvān bandhūn avasthitān || kṛipayā parayāviṣhṭo viṣhīdann idam abravīt |
text_english: Seeing all his relatives present there, Arjun, the son of Kunti, was overwhelmed with compassion, and with deep sorrow, spoke the following words.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच: दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम् || सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति ||
text_transliteration: arjuna uvācha: dṛiṣhṭvemaṁ sva-janaṁ kṛiṣhṇa yuyutsuṁ samupasthitam || sīdanti mama gātrāṇi mukhaṁ cha pariśhuṣhyati |
text_english: Arjun said: O Krishna, seeing my own kinsmen arrayed for battle here and intent on killing each other, my limbs are giving way and my mouth is drying up.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते || गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्चै व परिदह्यते ||
text_transliteration: vepathuśh cha śharīre me roma-harṣhaśh cha jāyate || gāṇḍīvaṁ sraṁsate hastāt tvak chaiva paridahyate ||
text_english: My body is trembling, my hair is standing on end. Gandiva is slipping from my hand, and my skin is burning
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मन: ||
text_transliteration: na cha śhaknomy avasthātuṁ bhramatīva cha me manaḥ ||
text_english: I am unable to stand firm, and my mind seems to be reeling.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव | न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ||
text_transliteration: nimittāni cha paśhyāmi viparītāni keśhava | na cha śhreyo ’nupaśhyāmi hatvā sva-janam āhave ||
text_english: O Keshava, I see omens that are unfavorable, and I do not foresee any good in killing my own people in this battle.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च | किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा ||
text_transliteration: na kāṅkṣhe vijayaṁ kṛiṣhṇa na cha rājyaṁ sukhāni cha | kiṁ no rājyena govinda kiṁ bhogair jīvitena vā ||
text_english: I do not desire victory, O Krishna, nor kingdom, nor pleasures. Of what use to us is a kingdom, Govinda, or enjoyment, or even life itself?
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगा: सुखानि च | त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ||
text_transliteration: yeṣhām arthe kāṅkṣhitaṁ no rājyaṁ bhogāḥ sukhāni cha | ta ime ’vasthitā yuddhe prāṇāṁs tyaktvā dhanāni cha ||
text_english: Those for whose sake we desire kingdom, enjoyments, and pleasures— they stand here in battle, having renounced their lives and wealth.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: आचार्या: पितर: पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहा: | मातुला: श्वशुरा: पौत्रा: श्याला: सम्बन्धिनस्तथा ||
text_transliteration: āchāryāḥ pitaraḥ putrās tathaiva cha pitāmahāḥ | mātulāḥ śhvaśhurāḥ pautrāḥ śhyālāḥ sambandhinas tathā ||
text_english: Teachers, fathers, sons, and likewise grandfathers; maternal uncles, fathers-in-law, grandsons, brothers-in-law and other relatives as well.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन | अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतो: किं नु महीकृते ||
text_transliteration: etān na hantum ichchhāmi ghnato ’pi madhusūdana | api trailokya-rājyasya hetoḥ kiṁ nu mahī-kṛite ||
text_english: O Madhusūdana (Krishna), I do not wish to kill them, even if they kill me— not even for the sake of sovereignty over the three worlds,let alone for this earth.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्न: का प्रीति: स्याज्जनार्दन | पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिन: ||
text_transliteration: nihatya dhārtarāṣhṭrān naḥ kā prītiḥ syāj janārdana | pāpam evāśhrayed asmān hatvaitān ātatāyinaḥ ||
text_english: O Janardana, what pleasure would be ours after killing the sons of Dhritarashtra? Sin alone would cling to us if we slew these aggressors.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्स्वबान्धवान् | स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिन: स्याम माधव ||
text_transliteration: tasmān nārhā vayaṁ hantuṁ dhārtarāṣhṭrān sa-bāndhavān | sva-janaṁ hi kathaṁ hatvā sukhinaḥ syāma mādhava ||
text_english: Therefore, we are not justified in killing the sons of Dhritarashtra, who are our own kinsmen. How, O Madhava, could we ever be happy after killing our own people?
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतस: | कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् ||
text_transliteration: yady apy ete na paśhyanti lobhopahata-chetasaḥ | kula-kṣhaya-kṛitaṁ doṣhaṁ mitra-drohe cha pātakam ||
text_english: Even though these men, their minds overpowered by greed, do not see the evil in destroying the family, nor the sin in betraying friends,
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभि: पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम् | कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन ||
text_transliteration: kathaṁ na jñeyam asmābhiḥ pāpād asmān nivartitum | kula-kṣhaya-kṛitaṁ doṣhaṁ prapaśhyadbhir janārdana ||
text_english: O Janardana, how could we not understand this, and how could we not turn away from this sin, we who clearly see the fault that arises from the destruction of the family?
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: kula-kṣhaye praṇaśhyanti kula-dharmāḥ sanātanāḥ | dharme naṣhṭe kulaṁ kṛitsnam adharmo ’bhibhavaty uta ||
text_english: With the destruction of the family, the eternal family traditions are destroyed; when righteousness is lost, the entire family is overwhelmed by unrighteousness.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रिय: | स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्कर: ||
text_transliteration: adharmābhibhavāt kṛiṣhṇa praduṣhyanti kula-striyaḥ | strīṣhu duṣhṭāsu vārṣhṇeya jāyate varṇa-saṅkaraḥ ||
text_english: When unrighteousness overwhelms the family, O Krishna, the women of the family become corrupted; and when women are corrupted, O descendant of the Vrishnis, social confusion (intermixture of castes) arises.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्नानां कुलस्य च | पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रिया: ||
text_transliteration: saṅkaro narakāyaiva kula-ghnānāṁ kulasya cha | patanti pitaro hy eṣhāṁ lupta-piṇḍodaka-kriyāḥ ||
text_english: Such social disorder leads the destroyers of the family and the family itself to hell; their ancestors fall, deprived of the offerings of food and water.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: दोषैरेतै: कुलघ्नानां वर्णसङ्करकारकै: | उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्मा: कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वता: ||
text_transliteration: doṣhair etaiḥ kula-ghnānāṁ varṇa-saṅkara-kārakaiḥ | utsādyante jāti-dharmāḥ kula-dharmāśh cha śhāśhvatāḥ ||
text_english: By these faults of the destroyers of the family—who create social disorder— the eternal duties of caste and family traditions are completely destroyed.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन | नरकेऽनियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुशुश्रुम ||
text_transliteration: utsanna-kula-dharmāṇāṁ manuṣhyāṇāṁ janārdana | narake ‘niyataṁ vāso bhavatītyanuśhuśhruma ||
text_english: O Janardana, we have heard from authoritative sources that those people whose family traditions are destroyed must dwell in hell for an indefinite period.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् | यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यता: ||
text_transliteration: aho bata mahat pāpaṁ kartuṁ vyavasitā vayam | yad rājya-sukha-lobhena hantuṁ sva-janam udyatāḥ ||
text_english: Alas, how grievous a sin we are determined to commit, for the sake of the greed for royal pleasure, we are prepared to kill our own kinsmen.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणय: | धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत् ||
text_transliteration: yadi mām apratīkāram aśhastraṁ śhastra-pāṇayaḥ | dhārtarāṣhṭrā raṇe hanyus tan me kṣhemataraṁ bhavet ||
text_english: If, in battle, the sons of Dhritarashtra, armed with weapons, kill me unresisting, it would be far better for me.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच: एवमुक्त्वार्जुन: सङ्ख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् | विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्नमानस: ||
text_transliteration: sañjaya uvācha: evam uktvārjunaḥ saṅkhye rathopastha upāviśhat | visṛijya sa-śharaṁ chāpaṁ śhoka-saṁvigna-mānasaḥ ||
text_english: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, Arjuna, overwhelmed with sorrow, sat down on the chariot, casting aside his bow and arrows, his mind full of grief..
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच । तं तथा कृपयाऽविष्टमश्रुपूर्णाकुलेक्षणम् । विषीदन्तमिदं वाक्यमुवाच मधुसूदनः ॥
text_transliteration: sañjaya uvāca | taṃ tathā kṛpayāviṣṭam aśru-pūrṇākulekṣaṇam | viṣīdantam idaṃ vākyam uvāca madhusūdanaḥ ||
text_english: Sanjaya said: Seeing Arjuna overwhelmed with compassion, his eyes filled with tears and grief, Madhusudana (Krishna) spoke these words.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । कुतस्त्वा कश्मलमिदं विषमे समुपस्थितम् । अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यमकीर्तिकरमर्जुन ॥
text_transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | kutaḥ tvā kaśmalam idaṃ viṣame samupasthitam | anārya-juṣṭam asvargyam akīrti-karam arjuna ||
text_english: The Supreme Lord said: O Arjuna, how has this delusion come upon you at this critical moment? It is not befitting the noble, nor does it lead to heaven or fame.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते । क्षुद्रं हृदयदौर्बल्यं त्यक्त्वोत्तिष्ठ परन्तप ॥
text_transliteration: klaibyaṃ mā sma gamaḥ pārtha naitat tvayy upapadyate | kṣudraṃ hṛdaya-daurbalyaṃ tyaktvottiṣṭha parantapa ||
text_english: Do not yield to weakness, O Partha. It does not befit you. Abandon this petty weakness of heart and arise, O conqueror of enemies.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच । कथं भीष्ममहं संख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन । इषुभिः प्रतियोत्स्यामि पूजार्हावरिसूदन ॥
text_transliteration: arjuna uvāca | kathaṃ bhīṣmam ahaṃ saṅkhye droṇaṃ ca madhusūdana | iṣubhiḥ pratiyotsyāmi pūjārhāv ari-sūdana ||
text_english: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana, how can I fight Bhishma and Drona with arrows in battle, when they are worthy of worship?
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: गुरूनहत्वा हि महानुभावान् श्रेयो भोक्तुं भैक्ष्यमपीह लोके । हत्वार्थकामांस्तु गुरूनिहैव भुञ्जीय भोगान् रुधिरप्रदिग्धान् ॥
text_transliteration: gurūn ahatvā hi mahānubhāvān śreyo bhoktuṃ bhaikṣyam apīha loke | hatvārtha-kāmāṃs tu gurūn ihaiva bhuñjīya bhogān rudhira-pradigdhān ||
text_english: It is better to live by begging in this world than to slay such noble teachers. If I kill them, I will only enjoy blood-stained pleasures.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: न चैतद्विद्मः कतरन्नो गरीयो यद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयुः । यानेव हत्वा न जिजीविषामस्तेऽवस्थिताः प्रमुखे धार्तराष्ट्राः ॥
text_transliteration: na caitad vidmaḥ kataran no garīyo yad vā jayema yadi vā no jayeyuḥ | yān eva hatvā na jijīviṣāmas te ’vasthitāḥ pramukhe dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ ||
text_english: We do not know which is better—conquering them or being conquered by them. The sons of Dhritarashtra stand before us, and killing them we would not wish to live.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: कार्पण्यदोषोपहतस्वभावः पृच्छामि त्वां धर्मसम्मूढचेताः । यच्छ्रेयः स्यान्निश्चितं ब्रूहि तन्मे शिष्यस्तेऽहं शाधि मां त्वां प्रपन्नम् ॥
text_transliteration: kārpaṇya-doṣopahata-svabhāvaḥ pṛcchāmi tvāṃ dharma-sammūḍha-cetāḥ | yac chreyaḥ syān niścitaṃ brūhi tan me śiṣyas te ’haṃ śādhi māṃ tvāṃ prapannam ||
text_english: My nature is overwhelmed by weakness; my mind is confused about duty. I ask You to tell me decisively what is best. I am Your disciple; please instruct me, for I have surrendered to You.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: न हि प्रपश्यामि ममापनुद्याद्यच्छोकमुच्छोषणमिन्द्रियाणाम् । अवाप्य भूमावसपत्नमृद्धं राज्यं सुराणामपि चाधिपत्यम् ॥
text_transliteration: na hi prapaśyāmi mamāpanudyād yac chokam ucchoṣaṇam indriyāṇām | avāpya bhūmāv asapatnam ṛddhaṃ rājyaṃ surāṇām api cādhipatyam ||
text_english: I do not see anything that could remove this grief that is drying up my senses, even if I gained unrivaled sovereignty on earth or lordship over the gods.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच । एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशं गुडाकेशः परन्तपः । न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह ॥
text_transliteration: sañjaya uvāca | evam uktvā hṛṣīkeśaṃ guḍākeśaḥ parantapaḥ | na yotsya iti govindam uktvā tūṣṇīṃ babhūva ha ||
text_english: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, Arjuna told Krishna, 'I will not fight,' and then fell silent.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: तमुवाच हृषीकेशः प्रहसन्निव भारत । सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये विषीदन्तमिदं वचः ॥
text_transliteration: tam uvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ prahasan niva bhārata | senayor ubhayor madhye viṣīdantam idaṃ vacaḥ ||
text_english: O Bharata, Krishna spoke these words to the grief-stricken Arjuna, as if smiling, between the two armies.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । अशोच्यानन्वशोचस्त्वं प्रज्ञावादांश्च भाषसे । गतासूनगतासूंश्च नानुशोचन्ति पण्डिताः ॥
text_transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | aśocyān anvaśocas tvaṃ prajñā-vādāṃś ca bhāṣase | gatāsūn agatāsūṃś ca nānuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ ||
text_english: The Lord said: You grieve for those who should not be grieved for, yet you speak words of wisdom. The wise grieve neither for the living nor for the dead.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः । न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम् ॥
text_transliteration: na tv evāhaṃ jātu nāsaṃ na tvaṃ neme janādhipāḥ | na caiva na bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarve vayam ataḥ param ||
text_english: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor these kings; nor in the future shall any of us cease to be.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा । तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिर्धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति ॥
text_transliteration: dehino ’smin yathā dehe kaumāraṃ yauvanaṃ jarā | tathā dehāntara-prāptir dhīras tatra na muhyati ||
text_english: Just as the embodied soul passes from childhood to youth to old age, so it passes into another body. The wise are not deluded by this.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः । आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत ॥
text_transliteration: mātrā-sparśās tu kaunteya śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkha-dāḥ | āgamāpāyino ’nityās tāṃs titikṣasva bhārata ||
text_english: O son of Kunti, the contacts of the senses give rise to heat and cold, pleasure and pain. They are temporary—endure them, O Bharata.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ । समदुःखसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते ॥
text_transliteration: yaṃ hi na vyathayanty ete puruṣaṃ puruṣarṣabha | sama-duḥkha-sukhaṃ dhīraṃ so ’mṛtatvāya kalpate ||
text_english: O best among men, one who is not disturbed by pleasure and pain and remains steady becomes fit for immortality.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः । उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः ॥
text_transliteration: nāsato vidyate bhāvo nābhāvo vidyate sataḥ | ubhayor api dṛṣṭo ’ntas tv anayos tattva-darśibhiḥ ||
text_english: The unreal has no existence; the real never ceases to be. The truth about both has been realized by the seers.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् । विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति ॥
text_transliteration: avināśi tu tad viddhi yena sarvam idaṃ tatam | vināśam avyayasyāsya na kaścit kartum arhati ||
text_english: Know that to be indestructible by which all this is pervaded. None can bring destruction to the imperishable soul.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः । अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत ॥
text_transliteration: antavanta ime dehā nityasyoktāḥ śarīriṇaḥ | anāśino ’prameyasya tasmād yudhyasva bhārata ||
text_english: These bodies are perishable, but the soul is eternal, indestructible, and immeasurable. Therefore, fight, O Bharata.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम् । उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते ॥
text_transliteration: ya enaṃ vetti hantāraṃ yaś cainaṃ manyate hatam | ubhau tau na vijānīto nāyaṃ hanti na hanyate ||
text_english: He who thinks the soul kills or is killed does not understand; it neither kills nor is killed.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचिन् नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः । अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे ॥
text_transliteration: na jāyate mriyate vā kadācin nāyaṃ bhūtvā bhavitā vā na bhūyaḥ | ajo nityaḥ śāśvato ’yaṃ purāṇo na hanyate hanyamāne śarīre ||
text_english: The soul is never born nor does it die; it is unborn, eternal, everlasting, and ancient. It is not slain when the body is slain.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम् । कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम् ॥
text_transliteration: vedāvināśinaṃ nityaṃ ya enam ajam avyayam | kathaṃ sa puruṣaḥ pārtha kaṃ ghātayati hanti kam ||
text_english: Knowing the soul to be indestructible and eternal, how can one kill anyone or cause anyone to be killed?
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि । तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णान्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही ॥
text_transliteration: vāsāṃsi jīrṇāni yathā vihāya navāni gṛhṇāti naro ’parāṇi | tathā śarīrāṇi vihāya jīrṇāny anyāni saṃyāti navāni dehī ||
text_english: As a person discards worn-out clothes and puts on new ones, so the soul discards old bodies and enters new ones.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः । न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः ॥
text_transliteration: nainaṃ chindanti śastrāṇi nainaṃ dahati pāvakaḥ | na cainaṃ kledayanty āpo na śoṣayati mārutaḥ ||
text_english: Weapons do not cut the soul, fire does not burn it, water does not wet it, and wind does not dry it.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च । नित्यः सर्वगतः स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातनः ॥
text_transliteration: acchedyo ’yam adāhyo ’yam akledyo ’śoṣya eva ca | nityaḥ sarva-gataḥ sthāṇur acalo ’yaṃ sanātanaḥ ||
text_english: This soul is unbreakable, incombustible, insoluble, and cannot be dried. It is eternal, all-pervading, stable, immovable, and everlasting.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते । तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि ॥
text_transliteration: avyakto ’yam acintyo ’yam avikāryo ’yam ucyate | tasmād evaṃ viditvainaṃ nānuśocitum arhasi ||
text_english: It is said that the soul is unmanifest, inconceivable, and immutable. Knowing this, you should not grieve.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम् । तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
text_transliteration: atha cainaṃ nitya-jātaṃ nityaṃ vā manyase mṛtam | tathāpi tvaṃ mahā-bāho naivaṃ śocitum arhasi ||
text_english: Even if you think the soul is always born and always dies, O mighty-armed, still you should not grieve.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च । तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
text_transliteration: jātasya hi dhruvo mṛtyur dhruvaṃ janma mṛtasya ca | tasmād aparihārye ’rthe na tvaṃ śocitum arhasi ||
text_english: Death is certain for one who is born, and rebirth is certain for one who has died. Therefore, you should not lament the inevitable.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत । अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना ॥
text_transliteration: avyaktādīni bhūtāni vyakta-madhyāni bhārata | avyakta-nidhanāny eva tatra kā paridevanā ||
text_english: Beings are unmanifest in the beginning, manifest in the middle, and unmanifest again in the end. What is there to grieve about?
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेनमाश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्यः । आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः शृणोति श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित् ॥
text_transliteration: āścaryavat paśyati kaścid enam āścaryavad vadati tathaiva cānyaḥ | āścaryavac cainam anyaḥ śṛṇoti śrutvāpy enaṃ veda na caiva kaścit ||
text_english: Some see the soul as a wonder, some speak of it as a wonder, some hear of it as a wonder—yet none truly understand it.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत । तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
text_transliteration: dehī nityam avadhyo ’yaṃ dehe sarvasya bhārata | tasmāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni na tvaṃ śocitum arhasi ||
text_english: The soul dwelling in all bodies is eternal and can never be slain. Therefore, do not grieve for any being.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि । धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽन्यत्क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते ॥
text_transliteration: sva-dharmam api cāvekṣya na vikampitum arhasi | dharmyād dhi yuddhāc chreyo ’nyat kṣatriyasya na vidyate ||
text_english: Considering your duty as a warrior, you should not waver. There is nothing better for a Kshatriya than a righteous war.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम् । सुखिनः क्षत्रियाः पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम् ॥
text_transliteration: yadṛcchayā copapannaṃ svarga-dvāram apāvṛtam | sukhinaḥ kṣatriyāḥ pārtha labhante yuddham īdṛśam ||
text_english: Happy are the warriors, O Partha, who obtain such a battle, opening the doors of heaven by chance.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं संग्रामं न करिष्यसि । ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि ॥
text_transliteration: atha cet tvam imaṃ dharmyaṃ saṅgrāmaṃ na kariṣyasi | tataḥ sva-dharmaṃ kīrtiṃ ca hitvā pāpam avāpsyasi ||
text_english: If you do not fight this righteous battle, you will abandon your duty and honor and incur sin.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम् । सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते ॥
text_transliteration: akīrtiṃ cāpi bhūtāni kathayiṣyanti te ’vyayām | sambhāvitasya cākīrtir maraṇād atiricyate ||
text_english: People will speak of your lasting infamy, and for a respected person, disgrace is worse than death.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः । येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम् ॥
text_transliteration: bhayād raṇād uparataṃ maṃsyante tvāṃ mahā-rathāḥ | yeṣāṃ ca tvaṃ bahu-mato bhūtvā yāsyasi lāghavam ||
text_english: The great warriors will think that you withdrew from battle out of fear, and you will fall from the esteem in which you were held.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून् वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः । निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम् ॥
text_transliteration: avācya-vādāṃś ca bahūn vadiṣyanti tavāhitāḥ | nindantas tava sāmarthyaṃ tato duḥkhataraṃ nu kim ||
text_english: Your enemies will speak many unseemly words, mocking your strength. What could be more painful than that?
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् । तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः ॥
text_transliteration: hato vā prāpsyasi svargaṃ jitvā vā bhokṣyase mahīm | tasmād uttiṣṭha kaunteya yuddhāya kṛta-niścayaḥ ||
text_english: If slain, you will attain heaven; if victorious, you will enjoy the earth. Therefore arise, O son of Kunti, resolved to fight.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ । ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि ॥
text_transliteration: sukha-duḥkhe same kṛtvā lābhālābhau jayājayau | tato yuddhāya yujyasva naivaṃ pāpam avāpsyasi ||
text_english: Treat pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat alike. Then engage in battle; thus you will not incur sin.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु । बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि ॥
text_transliteration: eṣā te ’bhihitā sāṅkhye buddhir yoge tv imāṃ śṛṇu | buddhyā yukto yayā pārtha karma-bandhaṃ prahāsyasi ||
text_english: This wisdom has been explained according to Sankhya; now hear it as Yoga. Endowed with this understanding, you will break free from the bondage of action.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते । स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात् ॥
text_transliteration: nehābhikrama-nāśo ’sti pratyavāyo na vidyate | svalpam apy asya dharmasya trāyate mahato bhayāt ||
text_english: In this path, there is no loss of effort nor any adverse result. Even a little practice of this dharma saves one from great fear.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन । बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम् ॥
text_transliteration: vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kuru-nandana | bahu-śākhā hy anantāś ca buddhayo ’vyavasāyinām ||
text_english: Those on this path are resolute in purpose, O joy of the Kurus, while the intellect of the irresolute is many-branched and endless.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः । वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः ॥
text_transliteration: yām imāṃ puṣpitāṃ vācaṃ pravadanty avipaścitaḥ | veda-vāda-ratāḥ pārtha nānyad astīti vādinaḥ ||
text_english: The unwise speak flowery words, O Partha, delighting in the ritualistic portions of the Vedas, declaring that nothing else exists.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम् । क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति ॥
text_transliteration: kāmātmānaḥ svarga-parā janma-karma-phala-pradām | kriyā-viśeṣa-bahulāṃ bhogaiśvarya-gatiṃ prati ||
text_english: With minds full of desire and aiming at heaven, they speak of rituals promising rebirth and reward, leading to enjoyment and power.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम् । व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते ॥
text_transliteration: bhogaiśvarya-prasaktānāṃ tayāpahṛta-cetasām | vyavasāyātmikā buddhiḥ samādhau na vidhīyate ||
text_english: For those attached to pleasure and power, whose minds are stolen by such things, resolute understanding does not arise in samadhi.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन । निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान् ॥
text_transliteration: trai-guṇya-viṣayā vedā nistrai-guṇyo bhavārjuna | nirdvandvo nitya-sattva-stho niryoga-kṣema ātmavān ||
text_english: The Vedas deal with the three gunas; rise above them, O Arjuna. Be free from duality, established in purity, and self-possessed.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः सम्प्लुतोदके । तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः ॥
text_transliteration: yāvān artha udapāne sarvataḥ samplutodake | tāvān sarveṣu vedeṣu brāhmaṇasya vijānataḥ ||
text_english: For one who knows the truth, all the Vedas are as useful as a well when the whole land is flooded.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन । मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ॥
text_transliteration: karmaṇy evādhikāras te mā phaleṣu kadācana | mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo ’stvakarmaṇi ||
text_english: You have the right to action alone, never to its fruits. Do not be motivated by results, nor be attached to inaction.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय । सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते ॥
text_transliteration: yoga-sthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā dhanañjaya | siddhy-asiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṃ yoga ucyate ||
text_english: Established in yoga, perform actions abandoning attachment. Be even-minded in success and failure—this equanimity is yoga.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय । बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः ॥
text_transliteration: dūreṇa hy avaraṃ karma buddhi-yogād dhanañjaya | buddhau śaraṇam anviccha kṛpaṇāḥ phala-hetavaḥ ||
text_english: Action done for reward is far inferior to action done with wisdom. Seek refuge in wisdom; pitiful are those motivated by results.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते । तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम् ॥
text_transliteration: buddhi-yukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛta-duṣkṛte | tasmād yogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśalam ||
text_english: Endowed with wisdom, one casts off both good and bad deeds. Therefore, devote yourself to yoga—yoga is skill in action.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः । जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम् ॥
text_transliteration: karma-jaṃ buddhi-yuktā hi phalaṃ tyaktvā manīṣiṇaḥ | janma-bandha-vinirmuktāḥ padaṃ gacchanty anāmayam ||
text_english: The wise, endowed with wisdom, abandon the fruits of action and are freed from the bondage of birth, attaining a state beyond sorrow.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति । तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च ॥
text_transliteration: yadā te moha-kalilaṃ buddhir vyatitariṣyati | tadā gantāsi nirvedaṃ śrotavyasya śrutasya ca ||
text_english: When your intellect crosses beyond the mire of delusion, you will become indifferent to what has been heard and what is yet to be heard.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला । समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि ॥
text_transliteration: śruti-vipratipannā te yadā sthāsyati niścalā | samādhāv acalā buddhis tadā yogam avāpsyasi ||
text_english: When your intellect, confused by scriptural opinions, becomes steady and fixed in samadhi, then you will attain yoga.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच । स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव । स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम् ॥
text_transliteration: arjuna uvāca | sthita-prajñasya kā bhāṣā samādhi-sthasya keśava | sthita-dhīḥ kiṃ prabhāṣeta kim āsīta vrajeta kim ||
text_english: Arjuna said: O Keshava, what are the characteristics of one of steady wisdom? How does such a person speak, sit, and walk?
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । प्रजहाति यदा कामान् सर्वान् पार्थ मनोगतान् । आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते ॥
text_transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | prajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān pārtha mano-gatān | ātmany evātmanā tuṣṭaḥ sthita-prajñas tadocyate ||
text_english: The Lord said: When one completely abandons all desires of the mind and is satisfied in the Self alone, he is said to be of steady wisdom.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः । वीतरागभयक्रोधः स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते ॥
text_transliteration: duḥkheṣv anudvigna-manāḥ sukheṣu vigata-spṛhaḥ | vīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhaḥ sthita-dhīr munir ucyate ||
text_english: One whose mind is not disturbed by sorrow, who does not crave pleasure, and who is free from attachment, fear, and anger, is called a sage of steady wisdom.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् । नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥
text_transliteration: yaḥ sarvatrānabhisnehas tat tat prāpya śubhāśubham | nābhinandati na dveṣṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||
text_english: One who is unattached everywhere, who neither rejoices nor hates upon attaining good or bad, his wisdom is firmly established.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः । इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥
text_transliteration: yadā saṃharate cāyaṃ kūrmo ’ṅgānīva sarvaśaḥ | indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||
text_english: When one withdraws the senses from sense-objects as a tortoise withdraws its limbs, his wisdom is firmly established.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः । रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते ॥
text_transliteration: viṣayā vinivartante nirāhārasya dehinaḥ | rasa-varjaṃ raso ’py asya paraṃ dṛṣṭvā nivartate ||
text_english: Sense-objects withdraw from the abstinent, but the taste for them remains; even that taste disappears upon realization of the Supreme.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः । इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः ॥
text_transliteration: yatato hy api kaunteya puruṣasya vipaścitaḥ | indriyāṇi pramāthīni haranti prasabhaṃ manaḥ ||
text_english: Even for the wise who strive for perfection, the turbulent senses violently carry away the mind.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः । वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥
text_transliteration: tāni sarvāṇi saṃyamya yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ | vaśe hi yasyendriyāṇi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||
text_english: Controlling all the senses, one should sit absorbed in Me. For one whose senses are under control, wisdom is firmly established.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते । सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते ॥
text_transliteration: dhyāyato viṣayān puṃsaḥ saṅgas teṣūpajāyate | saṅgāt sañjāyate kāmaḥ kāmāt krodho ’bhijāyate ||
text_english: While contemplating sense-objects, attachment arises; from attachment comes desire, and from desire arises anger.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्रमः । स्मृतिभ्रंशाद्बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति ॥
text_transliteration: krodhād bhavati sammohaḥ sammohāt smṛti-vibhramaḥ | smṛti-bhraṃśād buddhi-nāśo buddhi-nāśāt praṇaśyati ||
text_english: From anger comes delusion; from delusion, loss of memory; from loss of memory, destruction of intelligence; and from destruction of intelligence, one perishes.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन् । आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति ॥
text_transliteration: rāga-dveṣa-viyuktais tu viṣayān indriyaiś caran | ātma-vaśyair vidheyātmā prasādam adhigacchati ||
text_english: One who moves among sense-objects with senses under control, free from attachment and aversion, attains serenity.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते । प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धिः पर्यवतिष्ठते ॥
text_transliteration: prasāde sarva-duḥkhānāṃ hānir asyopajāyate | prasanna-cetaso hy āśu buddhiḥ paryavatiṣṭhate ||
text_english: In that serenity, all sorrows cease; for the tranquil-minded, intelligence soon becomes steady.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना । न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम् ॥
text_transliteration: nāsti buddhir ayuktasya na cāyuktasya bhāvanā | na cābhāvayataḥ śāntir aśāntasya kutaḥ sukham ||
text_english: There is no intelligence for the unsteady, nor contemplation for the unsteady; without peace there is no happiness—so how can there be joy?
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते । तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि ॥
text_transliteration: indriyāṇāṃ hi caratāṃ yan mano ’nuvidhīyate | tad asya harati prajñāṃ vāyur nāvam ivāmbhasi ||
text_english: When the mind follows the wandering senses, it carries away one’s wisdom like the wind carries a boat on water.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः । इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥
text_transliteration: tasmād yasya mahā-bāho nigṛhītāni sarvaśaḥ | indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||
text_english: Therefore, O mighty-armed one, he whose senses are fully restrained from their objects—his wisdom is firmly established.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी । यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः ॥
text_transliteration: yā niśā sarva-bhūtānāṃ tasyāṃ jāgarti saṃyamī | yasyāṃ jāgrati bhūtāni sā niśā paśyato muneḥ ||
text_english: What is night for all beings is wakefulness for the self-controlled; what beings see as wakefulness is night for the sage who sees.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत् । तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी ॥
text_transliteration: āpūryamāṇam acala-pratiṣṭhaṃ samudram āpaḥ praviśanti yadvat | tadvat kāmā yaṃ praviśanti sarve sa śāntim āpnoti na kāma-kāmī ||
text_english: As waters enter the ocean which remains unmoved, so desires enter one who is steady—he attains peace, not the seeker of desires.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्पृहः । निर्ममो निरहंकारः स शान्तिमधिगच्छति ॥
text_transliteration: vihāya kāmān yaḥ sarvān pumāṃś carati niḥspṛhaḥ | nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sa śāntim adhigacchati ||
text_english: One who abandons all desires and moves without longing, free from ego and possessiveness, attains peace.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति । स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति ॥
text_transliteration: eṣā brāhmī sthitiḥ pārtha naināṃ prāpya vimuhyati | sthitvāsyām anta-kāle ’pi brahma-nirvāṇam ṛcchati ||
text_english: This is the Brahmic state, O Partha. Attaining it, one is never deluded. Even at the moment of death, one reaches liberation in Brahman.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच । ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन । तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव ॥
text_transliteration: arjuna uvāca | jyāyasī cet karmaṇas te matā buddhir janārdana | tat kiṃ karmaṇi ghore māṃ niyojayasi keśava ||
text_english: Arjuna said: If You consider knowledge superior to action, O Janardana, then why do You urge me to engage in this terrible action, O Keshava?
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे । तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम् ॥
text_transliteration: vyāmiśreṇeva vākyena buddhiṃ mohayasīva me | tad ekaṃ vada niścitya yena śreyo ’ham āpnuyām ||
text_english: With these confusing words, You seem to bewilder my understanding. Please tell me decisively the one path by which I may attain the highest good.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । लोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ । ज्ञानयोगेन सांख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम् ॥
text_transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | loke ’smin dvi-vidhā niṣṭhā purā proktā mayānagha | jñāna-yogena sāṅkhyānāṃ karma-yogena yoginām ||
text_english: The Blessed Lord said: O sinless one, in this world a twofold path was taught by Me earlier— the path of knowledge for the contemplative, and the path of action for the active.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते । न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति ॥
text_transliteration: na karmaṇām anārambhān naiṣkarmyaṃ puruṣo ’śnute | na ca saṃnyasanād eva siddhiṃ samadhigacchati ||
text_english: Not by abstaining from action does one attain freedom from action, nor by mere renunciation does one attain perfection.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् । कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः ॥
text_transliteration: na hi kaścit kṣaṇam api jātu tiṣṭhaty akarma-kṛt | kāryate hy avaśaḥ karma sarvaḥ prakṛti-jair guṇaiḥ ||
text_english: No one can remain inactive even for a moment; everyone is compelled to act by the qualities born of nature.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् । इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते ॥
text_transliteration: karmendriyāṇi saṃyamya ya āste manasā smaran | indriyārthān vimūḍhātmā mithyācāraḥ sa ucyate ||
text_english: One who restrains the organs of action but dwells in the mind on sense-objects is deluded and is called a hypocrite.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन । कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते ॥
text_transliteration: yas tv indriyāṇi manasā niyamyārabhate ’rjuna | karmendriyaiḥ karma-yogam asaktaḥ sa viśiṣyate ||
text_english: But one who controls the senses with the mind and engages the organs of action in Karma Yoga without attachment excels.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः । शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः ॥
text_transliteration: niyataṃ kuru karma tvaṃ karma jyāyo hy akarmaṇaḥ | śarīra-yātrāpi ca te na prasiddhyed akarmaṇaḥ ||
text_english: Perform your prescribed duty, for action is better than inaction. Even the maintenance of the body would not be possible without action.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः । तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर ॥
text_transliteration: yajñārthāt karmaṇo ’nyatra loko ’yaṃ karma-bandhanaḥ | tad-arthaṃ karma kaunteya mukta-saṅgaḥ samācara ||
text_english: Work done as sacrifice frees one; otherwise work binds this world. Therefore, O son of Kunti, perform your duties without attachment.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सहनं सर्वभूतेषु तिष्ठन्नात्मा समाहितः । दृष्ट्वा न चात्मनात्मानं कुतः सुखं कुतः दुःखम् ॥
text_transliteration: sahanaṃ sarva-bhūteṣu tiṣṭhanna-ātmā samāhitaḥ | dṛṣṭvā na cātmanātmānaṃ kutaḥ sukhaṃ kutaḥ duḥkham ||
text_english: By performing sacrifice, all beings are sustained; therefore, one should act, seeing the self in all, and the self in oneself.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यथाऽन्नं देवस्य भिषजं यजमानः सर्वभूतेषु खादति । ब्रह्मणे सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ॥
text_transliteration: yathā ’nnaṃ devasya bhiṣajaṃ yajamānaḥ sarva-bhūteṣu khādati | brahmaṇe sarvam idaṃ protaṃ sūtre maṇigaṇā iva ||
text_english: Just as the sacrificer consumes food intended for the deity, so all beings receive sustenance through the fruits of sacrifice, as beads are strung on a thread.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: देवान्भावयतां यज्ञैः सेव्यमानाः सुदुर्लभाः । अन्नदाता भक्त्या सन्तो मुनयो मानिनो नराः ॥
text_transliteration: devān bhāvayatāṃ yajñaiḥ sevyamānāḥ sudurlabhāḥ | annadātā bhaktyā santo munayo mānino narāḥ ||
text_english: The devas should be propitiated with sacrifice, and men of wisdom honor the provider of food, offering devotion, as the sages do.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषैः । भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पोष्यन्ति मां च शाश्वतं भुवि ॥
text_transliteration: yajña-śiṣṭāśinaḥ santo mucyante sarva-kilbiṣaiḥ | bhuñjate te tv aghaṃ poṣyanti māṃ ca śāśvataṃ bhuvi ||
text_english: The devotees of sacrifice, eating the remnants of the offering, are freed from all sins; the offering nourishes them, and sustains Me eternally on earth.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसंस्पृता: । यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यः यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः ॥
text_transliteration: annād bhavanti bhūtāni parjanyād annasaṃspṛtāḥ | yajñād bhavati parjanyaḥ yajñaḥ karma-samudbhavaḥ ||
text_english: From food, beings are born; from rain, food is produced; from sacrifice comes rain; sacrifice is born of action.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह य: । अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति ॥
text_transliteration: evaṃ pravartitaṃ cakraṃ nānuvartayatīha yaḥ | aghāyur indriyārāmo moghaṃ pārtha sa jīvati ||
text_english: He who does not follow the wheel of creation, O Partha, bound by desires of the senses, lives in vain and has a short life.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्त: पुरातन: । भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ॥
text_transliteration: sa evāyaṃ mayā te ’dya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ | bhakto ’si me sakhā ceti rahasyaṃ hy etad uttamam ||
text_english: This yoga, ancient and supreme, has been declared by Me today; you are My devotee and friend, therefore I reveal this supreme secret.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यदहं कर्माणि प्रवर्तयामि यज्ज्ञानं च वर्तते । तवांस्ते प्रसीदन्ति सर्वे देवा अन्नदातारकाः ॥
text_transliteration: yadahṃ karmāṇi pravartayāmi yaj jñānaṃ ca vartate | tavāṃ ste prasīdanti sarve devā annadātārakāḥ ||
text_english: Whatever actions I perform, and whatever knowledge exists, all the devas, who sustain food, take pleasure in you.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मण्यकर्म य: पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म य: । स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् ॥
text_transliteration: karmaṇyakarma yaḥ paśyed akarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ | sa buddhimān manuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsna-karma-kṛt ||
text_english: He who sees action in inaction and inaction in action is intelligent among men, and he is truly engaged in all actions.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर । असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुषः ॥
text_transliteration: tasmād asaktaḥ satataṃ kāryaṃ karma samācara | asakto hy ācaran karma param āpnoti pūruṣaḥ ||
text_english: Therefore, perform your duties constantly without attachment. By performing action without attachment, one attains the Supreme.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: योगिनोऽपि कर्माणि संन्यस्यास्ते सन्ति निश्छलाः । असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुषः ॥
text_transliteration: yogino ’pi karmāṇi saṃnyasyāste santi niścalāḥ | asakto hy ācaran karma param āpnoti pūruṣaḥ ||
text_english: Even the yogis perform actions, but with a steady mind, renouncing attachment. He who acts without attachment attains the highest.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् । कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः ॥
text_transliteration: na hi kaścit kṣaṇam api jātu tiṣṭhaty akarma-kṛt | kāryate hy avaśaḥ karma sarvaḥ prakṛti-jair guṇaiḥ ||
text_english: No one can remain inactive even for a moment; all are forced to act by the qualities born of nature.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच । तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थं परमं गुह्यं मम । योगं प्रोक्तमस्मि धर्म्यं च तत्र बहुसंख्यया ॥
text_transliteration: arjuna uvāca | teṣāmevānumkampārthaṃ paramam guhyaṃ mama | yogaṃ proktamasmi dharmyaṃ ca tatra bahu-saṅkhyayā ||
text_english: Arjuna said: For the sake of compassion toward them, You have spoken to me the supreme secret, the dharmic yoga, in great detail.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह य: । अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति ॥
text_transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | evaṃ pravartitaṃ cakraṃ nānuvartayatīha yaḥ | aghāyur indriyārāmo moghaṃ pārtha sa jīvati ||
text_english: The Blessed Lord said: One who does not follow the wheel of creation, O Partha, bound by desires of the senses, lives in vain and has a short life.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यदहं कर्माणि प्रवर्तयामि यज्ज्ञानं च वर्तते । तवांस्ते प्रसीदन्ति सर्वे देवा अन्नदातारकाः ॥
text_transliteration: yadahṃ karmāṇi pravartayāmi yaj jñānaṃ ca vartate | tavāṃ ste prasīdanti sarve devā annadātārakāḥ ||
text_english: Whatever actions I perform, and whatever knowledge exists, all the devas, who sustain food, take pleasure in you.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मण्यकर्म य: पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म य: । स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् ॥
text_transliteration: karmaṇyakarma yaḥ paśyed akarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ | sa buddhimān manuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsna-karma-kṛt ||
text_english: He who sees action in inaction and inaction in action is intelligent among men, and he is truly engaged in all actions.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सः कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः। स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत्॥
text_transliteration: saḥ karmaṇyakarma yaḥ paśyed akarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ | sa buddhimān manuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsna-karma-kṛt ||
text_english: He who sees action in inaction, and inaction in action, is wise among men; he is truly engaged in all deeds.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलस्येहि। इति धर्म्यं चोक्तं यत्सर्वेभ्यः पाण्डव भूयसा॥
text_transliteration: yoginaḥ karma kurvanti saṅgaṃ tyaktvā phalasyehi | iti dharmyaṃ coktaṃ yatsarvebhyaḥ pāṇḍava bhūyasā ||
text_english: The yogis perform their duties, renouncing attachment to the fruits, as I have explained, O Arjuna, for the welfare of all.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्तव्यं कर्म कुर्वन् लभते पुरुषः सुखम्। कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन॥
text_transliteration: kartavyaṃ karma kurvan labhate puruṣaḥ sukham | karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana ||
text_english: Man attains happiness by performing his duty; your right is only to action, never to its fruits.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सम्यक्संकल्पोऽपि योगी कर्म कुर्वन् न विश्रब्यते। फलं त्यक्त्वा सदा भक्तः स योगी न संशयः॥
text_transliteration: samyak-saṃkalpo ’pi yogī karma kurvan na viśrabyate | phalaṃ tyaktvā sadā bhaktaḥ sa yogī na saṃśayaḥ ||
text_english: Even with perfect resolve, the yogi acts without wavering, renouncing the fruits; ever devoted, he is indeed a true yogi.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि संन्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा। निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः॥
text_transliteration: mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasyādhyātma-cetasā | nirāśīr nirmamo bhūtvā yudhyasva vigatajvaraḥ ||
text_english: Surrendering all actions to Me with your mind focused on the Self, free from desire and ego, fight without anxiety.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात्। स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः॥
text_transliteration: śreyān svadharmo viguṇaḥ paradharmāt svanuṣṭhitāt | svadharme nidhanaṃ śreyaḥ paradharmo bhayāvahaḥ ||
text_english: Better is one’s own duty, though imperfectly performed, than the duty of another performed well; death in the performance of one’s own duty brings true honor, while the other is fraught with fear.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जन:। स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदअनुवर्तते॥
text_transliteration: yadyad ācarati śreṣṭhas tattadev etaro janaḥ | sa yat pramāṇaṃ kurute lokas tad anuvartate ||
text_english: Whatever actions the best men perform, common people follow; whatever standards they set, all the world pursues.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: लोकसंग्रहे समः कर्ता लोकहितार्थमात्रतः। ईश्वरपुत्रः सन्न्यासी भक्तः सदा न संशयः॥
text_transliteration: loka-saṃgrahe samaḥ kartā loka-hita-artham ātrataḥ | īśvara-putraḥ saṃnyāsī bhaktaḥ sadā na saṃśayaḥ ||
text_english: Equally engaged in the welfare of the world, a true renunciate acts only for the good of all; devoted, the servant of God has no doubt.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मण:। शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मण:॥
text_transliteration: niyataṃ kuru karma tvaṃ karma jyāyo hy akarmaṇaḥ | śarīra-yātrāpi ca te na prasiddhyed akarmaṇaḥ ||
text_english: Perform your prescribed duty; action is superior to inaction. Even the maintenance of your body is not possible without action.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मणा सर्वसुखं लभते न हि तस्य फलमिन्द्रियाणि। कर्मेणैव हि संसिद्धिं प्राप्यते पुरुषोऽपि॥
text_transliteration: karmaṇā sarva-sukhaṃ labhate na hi tasya phalam indriyāṇi | karmeṇaiva hi saṃsiddhiṃ prāpyate puruṣo ’pi ||
text_english: All happiness is attained through action; the senses cannot yield their results without it. Perfection is achieved through action alone.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
text_transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja | ahaṃ tvāṃ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucah ||
text_english: Abandoning all duties, take refuge in Me alone; I shall free you from all sins. Do not grieve.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: योगिनोऽपि कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलस्येहि। इति धर्म्यं चोक्तं यत्सर्वेभ्यः पाण्डव भूयसा॥
text_transliteration: yogino ’pi karma kurvanti saṅgaṃ tyaktvā phalasyehi | iti dharmyaṃ coktaṃ yatsarvebhyaḥ pāṇḍava bhūyasā ||
text_english: Even the yogis act, renouncing attachment to the fruits; this dharmic yoga I have spoken, O Arjuna, for the benefit of all.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अशेषेण कर्मणि तत्परः सततं यतः। स योगी च मे प्रियः स योगी न संशयः॥
text_transliteration: aśeṣeṇa karmaṇi tat paraḥ satataṃ yataḥ | sa yogī ca me priyaḥ sa yogī na saṃśayaḥ ||
text_english: Constantly engaged in all actions, devoted to Me, such a yogi is dear to Me; there is no doubt about it.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य सृष्टिः प्रकृतिसंभवः। दुष्करं किमकर्म यः सत्त्वानुरूपं कर्म॥
text_transliteration: sattvā-nurūpā sarvasya sṛṣṭiḥ prakṛti-saṃbhavaḥ | duṣkaraṃ kim akarma yaḥ sattvā-nurūpaṃ karma ||
text_english: All creation is born of the qualities of nature. What difficulty is there in action? Action suited to one’s qualities is natural.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत्। कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः॥
text_transliteration: na hi kaścit kṣaṇam api jātu tiṣṭhaty akarma-kṛt | kāryate hy avaśaḥ karma sarvaḥ prakṛti-jair guṇaiḥ ||
text_english: No one can remain inactive even for a moment; all are forced to act by the qualities born of nature.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जन:। स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदअनुवर्तते॥
text_transliteration: yadyad ācarati śreṣṭhas tattadev etaro janaḥ | sa yat pramāṇaṃ kurute lokas tad anuvartate ||
text_english: Whatever actions the best men perform, others follow; whatever standards they set, all the world pursues.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। हे कृष्ण, संसारसागर में मनुष्य कैसे आत्मसंयमित होकर कर्म कर सकते हैं? कृपया मुझे इसका रहस्य बताइए।
text_transliteration: arjuna uvāca | he kṛṣṇa, saṃsāra-sāgara meṃ manuṣya kaise ātma-saṃyamita hokar karma kar sakte hai? kṛipayā mujhe iska rahasya batāiye ||
text_english: Arjuna said: O Krishna, in this ocean of worldly existence, how can man perform his duties with self-restraint? Please reveal this secret to me.
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। यद्यपि सम्यग्य कर्म करोति, तथापि फल में आसक्त न हो। ऐसा व्यक्ति हमेशा संतुलित, संयमी और मेरे प्रिय होता है।
text_transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | yadyapi samyag karma karoti, tathāpi phal meṃ āsakt na ho | aisā vyakti hameśā santulit, saṃyami aur meṃre priya hota hai ||
text_english: The Blessed Lord said: Even if one performs action perfectly, without attachment to its fruits, he remains balanced, disciplined, and dear to Me.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम्। विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत्॥
text_transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca | imaṃ vivasvate yogaṃ proktavān aham avyayam | vivasvān manave prāha manur ikṣvākave ’bravīt ||
text_english: The Blessed Lord said: I taught this imperishable yoga to Vivasvan, the Sun God; Vivasvan taught it to Manu, and Manu imparted it to Iksvaku.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: एवं परंपराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः। अविंदत कार्त्स्न्येन यज्ञं चाप्युपासते तथा॥
text_transliteration: evaṃ paraṃparā-prāptam imaṃ rājarsayo viduḥ | avindata kārtsnyaena yajñaṃ ca apy upāsate tathā ||
text_english: Thus, this knowledge has come down in succession from the great royal sages. Those who understand it perform sacrifice with full faith and devotion.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: एवं ज्ञात्वा क्वचिदपि कर्म गच्छेदज्ञानात्मन:। बुद्ध्याऽभ्यासेन तेन तद्विद्वान्युक्तः कार्यं च॥
text_transliteration: evaṃ jñātvā kvacid api karma gacched ajñānātmanah | buddhyā ’bhyāsena tena tad vidvān yuktaḥ kāryaṃ ca ||
text_english: Knowing this, one should act according to his duty, even if he is ignorant; with intelligence and practice, the wise perform their work correctly.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: विवस्वान् देवस्य सुतः मानवः प्रचक्षते। देवर्षीणां महात्मानां तत्त्वं जानाति सः॥
text_transliteration: vivasvān devasya sutaḥ mānavaḥ pracakṣate | devarṣīṇāṃ mahātmānāṃ tattvaṃ jānāti saḥ ||
text_english: Vivasvan, the son of the deity, is called Manu by men; he knows the truth and understands the knowledge of the great souls.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन। तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप॥
text_transliteration: bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava cārjuna | tāny ahaṃ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṃ vettha parantapa ||
text_english: Many births of Mine have passed, O Arjuna. I know them all, but you do not, O scorcher of foes.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: लोकसङ्ग्रहाय समः सर्वभूतानामच्युत। इच्छामि तु तस्य कर्मणि मया स्फुटं प्रवर्तितम्॥
text_transliteration: lokasaṅgrahāya samaḥ sarvabhūtānām acyuta | icchāmi tu tasya karmaṇi mayā sphuṭaṃ pravartitam ||
text_english: To protect the world and uphold dharma, I am born age after age, O infallible one.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत। अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम्॥
text_transliteration: yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārata | abhyutthānam adharmasya tadātmānaṃ sṛjāmy aham ||
text_english: Whenever there is a decline of righteousness and rise of unrighteousness, O Bharata, then I manifest Myself.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम्। धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे॥
text_transliteration: paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṃ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām | dharma-saṃsthāpanārthāya sambhavāmi yuge yuge ||
text_english: For the protection of the virtuous, the destruction of evil-doers, and the establishment of dharma, I appear in every age.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः। त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन॥
text_transliteration: janma karma ca me divyam evaṃ yo vetti tattvataḥ | tyaktvā dehaṃ punar janma naiti mām eti so ’rjuna ||
text_english: He who knows the divine nature of My birth and activities, O Arjuna, does not return to birth after leaving the body; he attains Me.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: भूतभृन्मा त्वं मम शिष्यः। धर्मेण तु साधनं कुर्वन्। संन्यासयोगेन च सदा। मोक्षं प्राप्स्यसि न संशयः॥
text_transliteration: bhūta-bhṛn mā tvaṃ mama śiṣyaḥ | dharmeṇa tu sādhanam kurvan | saṃnyāsa-yogena ca sadā | mokṣaṃ prāpsyasi na saṃśayaḥ ||
text_english: You are My disciple, O Bhṛn. By performing duty righteously and practicing renunciation and yoga, you will attain liberation without doubt.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः। स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत्॥
text_transliteration: karmany akarma yaḥ paśyed akarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ | sa buddhimān manuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsna-karma-kṛt ||
text_english: He who sees action in inaction, and inaction in action, is intelligent among men; he is a yogi who performs all actions.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्ति न कर्मणि नास्ति। तस्मादकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः॥
text_transliteration: karmaṇai eva hi saṃsiddhim āsti na karmaṇi nāsti | tasmād akarma yaḥ paśyed akarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ ||
text_english: Perfection comes only through action; it is not found in inaction. Therefore, he who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is wise.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः। तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम्॥
text_transliteration: cātur-varṇyaṃ mayā sṛṣṭaṃ guṇa-karma-vibhāgaśaḥ | tasya kartāram api māṃ viddhy akartāram avyayam ||
text_english: I created the fourfold division of society according to qualities and actions. Know that I am the author, though immutable.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा। इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बन्ध्यते॥
text_transliteration: na māṃ karmāṇi limpanti na me karma-phale spṛhā | iti māṃ yo ’bhijānāti karma-bhir na sa bandhya-te ||
text_english: My actions do not bind Me, nor am I attached to their results. He who knows this, O Arjuna, is not bound by actions.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी योगी युक्त इत्युच्यते। युञ्जन्नेवं सदाऽकर्मा कर्मफलत्यागश्च यः॥
text_transliteration: jñeyaḥ sa nitya-sannyāsī yogī yukta ity ucyate | yuñjannevaṃ sadā ’karmā karma-phala-tyāgaś ca yaḥ ||
text_english: He who is always renounced, a yogi, and engages in actions without attachment to their fruits is said to be united in yoga.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः। अकर्मणि च बोद्धव्यं गहनं कर्मणो घोरम्॥
text_transliteration: karmaṇo hy api boddhavyaṃ boddhavyaṃ ca vikarmaṇaḥ | akarmaṇi ca boddhavyaṃ gahanaṃ karmaṇo ghoram ||
text_english: Even the intricacies of action, non-action, and wrong action must be understood. Action is subtle and difficult to grasp.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया। उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः॥
text_transliteration: tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśnena sevayā | upadekṣyanti te jñānaṃ jñāninas tattva-darśinaḥ ||
text_english: Understand this knowledge through humble reverence, questioning, and service; the wise who see the truth will instruct you.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अत्यन्तं शीलसम्पन्नो यः युक्तः कर्मसु कृत्। न स सिद्धिमुपैति नाकर्ष्यते च तस्य यशः॥
text_transliteration: atyantaṃ śīla-sampanno yaḥ yuktaḥ karmasu kṛt | na sa siddhim upaiti nā karṣyate ca tasya yaśaḥ ||
text_english: He who is disciplined, engaged in action with devotion, does not fail to achieve perfection, nor is his reputation harmed.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सर्वकर्माणि मे यः संन्यस्यस्तु निराशी। योगयुक्तो म्रियते नैव कश्चित्कर्मफलप्रवृतिः॥
text_transliteration: sarva-karmāṇi me yaḥ sannyasya tu nirāśī | yoga-yukto mriyate naiva kaścit karma-phala-pravṛtiḥ ||
text_english: One who renounces all actions to Me, with mind unshaken and yoga-minded, neither acts for reward nor is bound by karma.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन। मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि॥
text_transliteration: karmaṇyevādhikāras te mā phaleṣu kadācana | mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo ’stvakarmaṇi ||
text_english: You have the right to action only, never to the fruits. Do not act for the results, nor be attached to inaction.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: समाहितो ह्येवं योगयुक्तो ममाश्रयः। सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य कृत्वा धनञ्जय॥
text_transliteration: samāhito hy evaṃ yoga-yukto mam āśrayaḥ | sarva-karmāṇi mayi sannyasya kṛtvā dhanañjaya ||
text_english: When one is thus established in yoga and takes refuge in Me, O Arjuna, performing all actions for Me, he attains freedom.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम्। नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता॥
text_transliteration: yaḥ sarvatra-anabhisnehah tat-tat prāpya śubhā-śubham | nābhinandati na dveṣṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||
text_english: He who is unattached to all things, seeing good and evil alike, neither rejoices nor hates, his wisdom is steady.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः। सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः॥
text_transliteration: yoga-yukto viśuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ | sukhaṃ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṃ sa yogī paramo mataḥ ||
text_english: A yogi, united in yoga, pure, self-controlled, conquering the senses, is considered supreme whether experiencing pleasure or pain.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम्। नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता॥
text_transliteration: yaḥ sarvatra-anabhisnehah tat-tat prāpya śubhā-śubham | nābhinandati na dveṣṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||
text_english: He who is free from attachment, seeing all beings alike, neither rejoices nor hates; his wisdom is firm.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अध्यात्मज्ञानसिद्धिः श्रुतिवैदिकसमाहितिः। युक्तः कर्मकुशलस्तथाप्यात्मन्येव चित्तवान्॥
text_transliteration: adhyātma-jñāna-siddhiḥ śruti-vedic-samāhitiḥ | yuktaḥ karma-kuśalaḥ tathāpy ātmanyeva cittavān ||
text_english: By knowledge of the self, by understanding the Vedic teachings, and by skillful action, one remains focused on the self.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानं विद्यान्न चिकीर्षते नश्यति। यस्य कृत्वा प्रवर्तते तस्मिन्नेव समाधौ स्थितः॥
text_transliteration: śreyo hi jñānaṃ vidyān na cikīrṣate naśyati | yasya kṛtvā pravartate tasminneva samādhau sthitaḥ ||
text_english: Knowledge is superior; it never fails. Whoever acts according to it attains perfect absorption.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यथेन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यानि सर्वशः। तथैव शरीरं कर्मैर्गुणैर्युक्तं समाचरेत्॥
text_transliteration: yathendriyāṇi manasā niyam yāni sarvaśaḥ | tathaiva śarīraṃ karmair guṇair yuktaṃ samācaret ||
text_english: As the senses are controlled by the mind, so the body should be controlled by actions done in accordance with one’s qualities.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: न हि देहभृत्यां कर्माणि सञ्चरन्ति केचिद्। यः स योगयुक्तः प्रोक्तो योगिनामपि स धर्मतः॥
text_transliteration: na hi deha-bhṛtyāṃ karmāṇi sañcaranti kecid | yaḥ sa yoga-yuktaḥ prokto yoginām api sa dharmataḥ ||
text_english: Not all actions are performed by the body alone; the soul, united with yoga, acts righteously even without attachment.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: ज्ञानेन तु तद्विद्धि ह्यात्मसंयमसंनिभम्। योगेन कर्मसु कौशलं सम्यगुपायतं च यतः॥
text_transliteration: jñānena tu tad viddhi hy ātma-saṃyama-sannibham | yogena karmasu kauśalaṃ samyag-upāyataṃ ca yataḥ ||
text_english: Know that self-discipline and yoga in actions is the true skill; it leads to proper understanding and perfection.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्त्वज्ञो न द्वेष्टि च। न स सिद्धिं प्राप्नोति तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता॥
text_transliteration: yaḥ sarvatra-anabhisnehah tattva-jño na dveṣṭi ca | na sa siddhiṃ prāpnoti tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||
text_english: He who is detached, knows the truth, and hates nothing attains perfection; his wisdom is established.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: आत्मन्येव चित्तं स्थित्यात्मन्येवाभिधीयते। युक्तः शास्त्रार्थविशारदः कर्मसंसिद्धये॥
text_transliteration: ātmanyeva cittaṃ sthityātmanyevābhidhīyate | yuktaḥ śāstra-artha-viśāradaḥ karma-saṃsiddhaye ||
text_english: Fix the mind on the self; the wise, skilled in scripture, acts for the perfection of action.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सर्वकर्माणि समाचरन् निःस्पृहः सति नरः। योगयोगेन चिकीर्षितं प्राप्नोति परमां गतिम्॥
text_transliteration: sarva-karmāṇi samācaran niḥspṛhaḥ sati naraḥ | yoga-yogena cikīrṣitaṃ prāpnoti paramāṃ gatim ||
text_english: A man who performs all actions without desire, united in yoga, attains the supreme goal.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन। मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि॥
text_transliteration: karmaṇyevādhikāras te mā phaleṣu kadācana | mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo ’stvakarmaṇi ||
text_english: You have the right to action only, never to its fruits; do not let the results of action be your motive, nor be attached to inaction.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: सर्वकर्माणि मन्मयि संन्यस्यात्मानं त्यजेत्। योगयुक्तः सदा कर्म कुर्वन्नात्मानं शान्तिम्॥
text_transliteration: sarva-karmāṇi man-mayi sannyasya ātmānaṃ tyajet | yoga-yuktaḥ sadā karma kurvan ātmānaṃ śāntim ||
text_english: Surrendering all actions to Me, and uniting the mind with yoga, one attains inner peace while performing duty.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनामुपदिष्टम्। कर्मणि संन्यासयोगेन। योगिनां योगसंसिद्धये॥
text_transliteration: jñānaṃ jñāninām upadiṣṭam | karmaṇi saṃnyāsa-yogena | yogināṃ yoga-saṃsiddhaye ||
text_english: Knowledge, taught to the wise, is attained through renunciation of actions and practice of yoga, leading yogis to perfection.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। एतेन मोक्षं कर्तुं किं न युक्तं कर्मणि? किं वा हि योगेन न मुक्ति: सिध्यति च॥
text_transliteration: arjuna uvāca | etena mokṣaṃ kartuṃ kiṃ na yuktaṃ karmaṇi? kiṃ vā hi yogena na muktiḥ sidhyati ca ||
text_english: Arjuna said: With this, why is it not possible to attain liberation through action and yoga?
speaker: Arjuna

text_sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। अप्यायं पुरुषः कर्ता न हि कर्मफलप्रीतिः। योगयुक्तो हि स सदा कर्मं समाचरति॥
text_transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca | apy āyaṃ puruṣaḥ kartā na hi karma-phala-prītiḥ | yoga-yukto hi sa sadā karmaṃ samācarati ||
text_english: The Blessed Lord said: The person who is united in yoga, without attachment to results, always performs actions.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: ज्ञानेन तु तद्विद्धि ह्यात्मसंयमसंनिभम्। योगेन कर्मसु कौशलं सम्यगुपायतं च यतः॥
text_transliteration: jñānena tu tad viddhi hy ātma-saṃyama-sannibham | yogena karmasu kauśalaṃ samyag-upāyataṃ ca yataḥ ||
text_english: Understand that knowledge of self, united with yoga, is skill in action and leads to perfection.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पुरुषः। यः स योगयुक्तो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियतमः॥
text_transliteration: asakto hy ācaran karma paramāpnoti puruṣaḥ | yaḥ sa yoga-yukto mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyatamaḥ ||
text_english: One who acts without attachment and is devoted to Me attains the supreme; such a yogi is dear to Me.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च। निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी॥
text_transliteration: adveṣṭā sarva-bhūtānāṃ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca | nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ kṣamī ||
text_english: One who hates no being, is friendly and compassionate, free from ego and attachment, equal in pleasure and pain, and forgiving, attains yoga.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: यः सदा परत्रानुबद्धो योगयुक्तो मम शरणः। स सर्वकर्माणि स्यान्निःसङ्गः परमां गतिम्॥
text_transliteration: yaḥ sadā paratra-anubaddho yoga-yukto mama śaraṇaḥ | sa sarva-karmāṇi syān niḥsaṅgaḥ paramāṃ gatim ||
text_english: He who always takes refuge in Me, united in yoga, performing all actions without attachment, attains the supreme goal.
speaker: Krishna

text_sanskrit: एषा योगविद्या प्रतिष्ठा यो यः स धर्मसङ्गतः। तस्माद्योगं समाचरन् मोक्षं प्राप्नोति सच्चरम्॥
text_transliteration: eṣā yoga-vidyā pratiṣṭhā yo yaḥ sa dharma-saṅgataḥ | tasmād yogaṃ samācaran mokṣaṃ prāpnoti saccaram ||
text_english: This knowledge of yoga is established; whoever performs duty with devotion attains liberation.
speaker: Krishna
